result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:21 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Joseph William Willis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Joseph William Willis.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard. 

State is heard on bond. State recommends that bond to be increased. 

Defendant comments. 

Court will order an additional $200.00 cash bond. Brings the total bond to $700.00. Non monetary conditions remain the same.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:03 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Joseph William Willis appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Joseph William Willis.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings.

Attorney Zaleski is heard waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.

Adjourned initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State Public Defender's Office indicates Joseph Willis called their office and does qualify for a public defender but they will not have anyone assigned to his case by 8/1/22.

2:16 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Joseph William Willis in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court questions def re: efforts to hire an attorney - Def. states he wishes to have court appoint him an attorney, unable to afford one.  Has not contacted Public defenders office

Court advises def. he must first apply to Public Defender's office - if he does not qualify, then court will consider appointing him an attorney. 
Def. is provided with both PD phone # and Court appointed paperwork at this time
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
